data.title: Robert Lowry D.D. (1826-1899)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Robert Lowry D.D. born 1826 Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States died 1899 Plainfield, Union, New Jersey, United States including parents + descendants + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Descendants

Profile last modified 23 Jun 2024 | Created 27 Mar 2018

This page has been accessed 665 times.

Biography

Robert was the only son of Crozier Lowry and Elizabeth Bannatyne

Robert was a Baptist minister and hymnwriter[1][2], the following are some of his songs:

Nothing But The Blood Of Jesus

Down In The Valley

Nothing But the Blood

Christ Arose (words and music)

Follow On (with William O. Cushing),

Shall We Gather At The River?

How Can I Keep From Singing?

Marching to Zion (tune)

Lowry combined his pastoral work with a professorship in rhetoric at his alma mater, and later served as the University's chancellor. From 1868 he acted as hymnals editor to Biglow and Main, the country's leading publisher of gospel and Sunday School music; under his supervision more than 20 hymnals were produced by the firm, many of wide and enduring popularity.

Despite his protestations that preaching was his main vocation and that music was merely a sideline, it is as a hymnwriter that Lowry is chiefly remembered, ranking with such as W. H. Doane and Ira D. Sankey as one of the originators of a musical tradition that has lasted until the modern era of revival.

Contents 1 Life 1.1 Early life 1.2 Ministry 1.3 Later years and death 2 Hymn writer 3 Assessment and legacy 4 Notes and references 4.1 Notes 4.2 References 4.3 Sources 5 External links

He married Anne Rhees Loxley in 1854.[3]

Children:

Harry Moore Lowry 1857–1927

Wheaton Smith Lowry 1859–1943

Benjamin Loxley Lowry b.Apr 1861-d.24 Oct 1862 (Listed under Ben Lonley Loury in the Mt. Moriah index)

Robert Hanson Lowry 1865–1960

In 1875 the University of Lewisburg, Pennsylvania (Bucknell University after 1886) bestowed upon him an honourary Doctorate of Divinity.[4]

The family was found in the 1880 US Federal Census in Plainfield, Union, New Jersey.[5] The household was enumerated as follows:

Robert Lowry Self Male 54 Pennsylvania, United States

Anna R Lowry Wife Female 52 Pennsylvania, United States

Harry M Lowry Son Male 23 Pennsylvania, United States

Wheaton S Lowry Son Male 21 New York, United States

Robert H Lowry Son Male 15 New York, United States

Mary J Loxley Mother-in-law Female 78 Pennsylvania, United States

Bertha A Piper Other Female 23 Virginia, United States

Robert married Mary Laing Runyon daughter of Enos W. Runyon and Katherine W. Vail in Manhattan, New York, New York on 27 Jun 1892.[6]

Robert is interred in the Hillside Cemetery, Scotch Plains, Union County, New Jersey, USA.[7]

Research notes

In the 1865 census Robert (age 39) was in Ward 11, Brooklyn, Kings, New York, United States.[8]

1865 Census: Ward 11, Brooklyn, Kings, New York, United States Name Relation Sex Age Robert Lowrey Head M 39 Anna R Lowrey Wife F 39 Harry M Lowrey Son M 8 Wheaton L Lowrey Son M 6 Robert H Lowrey Son M 0 Bridget Haggerty Servant F 30

In the 1870 census Robert (age 43) was in Lewisburg, Union, Pennsylvania, United States.[9]

1870 United States Federal Census: Lewisburg, Union, Pennsylvania, United States Name Sex Age Occupation Birth Place Robert Loury M 43 Pennsylvania Anna R Loury F 43 Pennsylvania Harry M Loury M 13 Pennsylvania Wheaton Loury M 11 New York Robert H Loury M 5 New York Mary J Loxley F 67 New Jersey Sarah Evans F 22 Maryland

In the 1880 census Robert (age 54) was the married head of household in Plainfield, Union, New Jersey, United States.[5]

1880 United States Federal Census: Plainfield, Union, New Jersey, United States Name Sex Age Occupation Birth Place Robert Lowry M 54 Clergyman Pennsylvania, United States Anna R. Lowry F 52 Keeps House Pennsylvania, United States Harry M. Lowry M 23 Student Pennsylvania, United States Wheaton S. Lowry M 21 Bookkeeper New York, United States Robert H. Lowry M 15 New York, United States Mary J. Loxley F 78 Pennsylvania, United States Bertha A. Piper F 23 Servant Virginia, United States
